subject: Jetboy Flies Again
event: Look up in the sky! It's a bird! It's a blimp!! No, it's FIVE blimps strung together!!! And here comes Jetboy... That was how the Wild Cards series began, way way back in 1987 before some of you were born. Here we are in 2009, and the series is still going strong. The new books, INSIDE STRAIGHT and BUSTED FLUSH (and don't forget SUICIDE KINGS, coming this December from Tor) have drawn a lot of new readers to our world of aces and jokers, and many of them have been emailing me to ask where they can find the old books. But with the original series long out of print, the best I could do was suggest that they search on ebay and ABE in hopes of turning up some used copies at a not-too-outrageous price. Well, all that is about to change. I'm pleased to announce that the response to the new Wild Cards books has been strong enough that our friends at Tor Books are going to start doing new editions of the original series -- starting right at the beginning with the first three volumes: WILD CARDS, ACES HIGH, and JOKERS WILD. Our first triad. Nothing is set in stone yet, but we're talking about bringing the books out as hardcovers (the old editions from Bantam and Titan were paperback originals, though the Science Fiction Book CLub did reprint volumes one through six as hardcovers)and possibly as omnibus editions. Details on that remain to be explored, but I'll be sure and keep you posted. But that's not even the best part yet. Longtime fans of the series may recall that the first book, WILD CARDS, was our historical volume, with stories that took us all the way from Dr. Tachyon's arrival on Earth in 1946 right up to the Wild Card "present," which back then was 1986. We had forty years to cover, and I like to think we covered it pretty well... but of course, there were gaps. Years and even decades of Wild Card history that we simply did not have the space to dramatize. Tor's new edition will help rectify that. We're not just reprinting the original WILD CARDS, as it was first published; we're adding three brand-new, original, never-before-published stories set during some of the "lost years" we couldn't cover last time around. So this edition of WILD CARDS will be the director's cut, if you will, fortified and expanded with original content, extra fiber, and three news tales: - Michael Cassutt will take us back to 1956 with, "Captain Cathode v the Secret Ace," - David D. Levine will visit 1960, to tell us about "Powers," and, - Carrie Vaughn will show us 1981, as "Ghost Girl Takes Manhattan." We think these will be three terrific new additions to the Wild Cards saga, and we're excited about the chance to present them to you. Look for the new expanded WILD CARDS some time in 2010. More details when I have 'em. We can't die yet. We haven't seen THE JOLSON STORY.

comments.article: Nice! Damnation, just when I thought it was safe to go to the bookstore again, you gotta go and get stuff reprinted things that have fallen into disrepair in my collection.
YES!

I still remember where I found my first Wild Card book. It was about 1987 and I was flying for some reason. In the airport the cover caught my eye and I bought the book. I was annoyed when the plane landed and I had to put my book away. I finished it that evening and kept an eye out for the next one and the one after that.

Never failed to entertain me and I still have my copies including a very tattered copies of the first couple of books.

With the new stories, I will be buying the re-issues.

Please please push for Massmarket or even trade paper releases. Working in a bookstore (B&N if you must know) I can tell you HC sales pale in comparison to TP/MM sales. Especially with the current economic set backs.

It's also much easier to sell someone on a new series when its MM/TP versus HC.

Oooohoooo... you're GOOD.
I was wondering how you'd entice me to pick up yet another edition of Wild Cards 1, given I have the Bantam paperback and the Byron Preiss edition as well. New material? Sign me up!
Oh, sweet!  I found the very first <u>Wild Cards</u> at a used bookstore and loved it, but haven't been able to track down the ensuing volumes for a reasonable price.  This is most welcome news!
That is fantastic, I have those 3 books, and the next 2 after them and this will allow me to read more Wild Cards as they are expensive to find online :(

Whoohoo!

I picked up my copies of these last summer. Then Hurricane Ike destroyed them (and most of my books and other stuff). I hadn't had any luck finding them again, after the storm.
That's good to hear. My old copies are getting shabby and the new material is an added bonus.
This is great news, my paperbacks are aging! New stories are welcome and I'd buy hardcovers!

Wild Cards is a big part of what got me started down the author path. I'm delighted to see it continuing on like this, and I'll look forward to the reissues. My first edition paperbacks are in pretty sad shape.

comments.article: This is great news. I've loved these books for close to 20 years, and now I can carry the series in my store and introduce them to a new generation of readers. Plus, I can't wait to get the new edition -- even if I just re-read the first book within the last year.
Wow. Brilliant news! The possible omnibus edition sounds like a must-have, but I'll definitely be getting hold of the new WILD CARDS even if you release in omnibus down the road as well.
This is very exciting for me! A chance to catch up from the beginning! :D

George... hardcovers?

Not that you're excited at the prospect, but I think I just got an erection.

Honestly, this may make me an actual Wild Cards collector. It will certainly make me more likely to buy the new ones in hardcover.

LOL.  When I read the subject header, I thought you were poking some gentle fun at the latest round of rumors about Brett Favre coming out of retirement now that he asked for his release and had it granted by the NY Jets.

Awesome!  I've never picked up a Wild Cards book, because starting such a long running series is pretty daunting.  But I liked the Wild Cards stories you included in Dreamsongs.  I'll definitely pick these up when they come out.

That is legen.... wait for it! ...dary! Thanks, George! I've been trying to figure out a way to get my mitts on those old copies ever since I picked up INSIDE STRAIGHT. Now I'll have a whole box of books to get signed at the next Wild Cards event in Albuquerque!
Excellent! It was absolutely maddening that I couldn't check out the early versions of this series. Congratulations, and thanks.

I love the Bolland covers too, but they've already been used twice, first by Titan, and then later on the iBooks editions.

Nothing has been decided yet, but my expectation would be that these editions would have brand new covers by Michael Komarck, to bring the look of the books in line with the new volumes.

And Komarck is doing some incredible work as well.
